thread.title: CORONA: Botched robbery dumps money in street
thread.title_full: CORONA: Botched robbery dumps money in street - Press Enterprise

author: RICHARD BROOKS
title: CORONA: Botched robbery dumps money in street
text:
BY RICHARD BROOKS / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 2, 2015 Updated: 9:30 p.m. CORONA: Botched robbery dumps money in street More Related article » It wasn't the smoothest holdup: A struggle for the cash sent money tumbling into a street.
The robbers retrieved some of it before they escaped.� Passersby also helped themselves.
The commotion erupted at 2:58 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, at Jays Market, 1267 W. Sixth Street, in Corona.
"The manager of the business had gone to the bank and was returning ... when he was approached by two (men) in their 30s," said Lt. Alan Lorton. "There was a struggle for the money.
"And in the struggle, some of the money came out of the bag ... and ended up being dropped on the ground."
The robbers grabbed some of the cash and fled in a Ford Explorer with no license plates.
Both robbers are in their 30s and were wearing black shorts. One had a white shirt. His accomplice had a red shirt. Neither displayed a weapon.
Also quick to disappear were some of the witnesses. And with good reason.
"People were helping themselves," Lorton said, "to somebody else's money."
